newsitem.title: JAPAN: Taisei expects 40 bln yen loss from property sales.
newsitem.headline: Taisei expects 40 bln yen loss from property sales.

text.p: Taisei Corp said on Thursday it expects a loss of 40 billion yen from sales of property, but that this would not mean a major change in its earnings forecast for the year to March 31, 1997.
Taisei said in a statement that it would sell some shareholdings to raise a profit of about 35 billion yen to help cover the loss from the planned property sales.
Taisei decided to sell part of the company's property to strengthen its financial health, it said.
The company has decided to sell property which it believes would be difficult to develop or which it thinks will not bring in more profit from a sale than it does now, it said.
